page.title: 05 ******ENERGY******
page.content: {Willington Power Station There are two stations on the Willington site, both quite similar. Willington'A'station began to generate electricity in 1957. When it is working at its full rate it burns 4000 tons of coal each day and of this coal there remains 800 tons of ash which is pumped away through pipelines and is used in making building blocks. Willington'B'stationbegan to generate in 1962.It produces more electricity than the 'A' station but for the same coal usage. The ash from the'B'station is taken away by lorry. When both stations are working, 26 million gallons of water are needed each hour.The river Trent supplies 16 million gallons each hour and the station condensers provide the rest. Hot water made within the plant is cooled before its return to the river.
